meanings.text: The vivid sleep when one thinks one is still awake.
Restless sleep; a period of wakefulness or partial wakefulness between periods of sleep.
Dozing, drowsiness, the state of being half-asleep, either napping or from exhaustion.

examples.first: Sin embargo, en esa duermevela, creo que intuí qué significa dirigir una orquesta.
examples.second: Yet, when half asleep, I thought I had sensed what it means to conduct an orchestra,

examples.first: ¿Es posible que estos respetables guardianes solo salgan de su duermevela cuando huelen carne fresca israelí?
examples.second: Could it be that these worthy watchdogs only awaken from their slumber when they smell fresh Israeli meat?

examples.first: Yo maté al zorro más grande, y ahora estoy de duermevela con los demás, en la era.
examples.second: I had killed the largest fox, and with it, I dissed the others on the run.

examples.first: Pasáis todo el tiempo en un duermevela.
examples.second: Spend all your time in a twilight sleep.

examples.first: Era solo un adormecimiento, el duermevela que preceda al despertar.
examples.second: It was just half-sleep, the drowsiness before waking.
